channel.title: Top 5 all time favourite PC games?
channel.description:
What is everyone's 5 favourite pc games that really stand out to them? I need a new game to play.
In before HALOHALOHALOWOWWOW
My five:
Deus Ex 1 (fucking brilliant game) The Secret of Monkey Island (^) KOTOR1+2 Phantasie 3 (One of, if not the first non text RPG - is easily better than 98%+ of RPGs today) Tie between AOE2 expansion, GH2, and fear.

@army_life wrote:

item.source: Top 5 all time favourite PC games?

item.title: Top 5 all time favourite PC games?
item.dc:creator: @The_Un-Named The Un-Named
item.description:
@The_Un-Named wrote:

[quote=“Thug-life, post:4, topic:230928”]Metal gear solid 1 - Yes i know it was originally a console game but they did port it to PC, even if the controls were horrible, still one of the best games i have ever played
Portal[/quote]

Age of Empires III
GTA: Vice City
Dungeon Siege

Although looking back, Portal gets really boring the second run through(or even the advanced chambers), I just find Dungeon Siege really boring now(although I had a lot of fun when I used to play multiplayer, which is now offline) and AOEIII can get boring.

As Thug-life said, MGS1’s PC port has HORRIBLE controls, but it’s still one of my most favourite games, just a shame my PS1 version has no continue screen on the second disc.

Read full topic

item.title: Top 5 all time favourite PC games?
item.dc:creator: @ThAt0n36Uy Elijah
item.description:
@ThAt0n36Uy wrote:

  1. Counter-Strike: 1.6
  2. The Elder Scrolls IV: Oblivion (I own the 360 version, PC version is even better)
  3. Counter-Strike: Source
  4. AoE II - The Conquerors Expansion
  5. Tribes: Vengeance (I only paid $1.00 for my copy of it, so that’s why I love it so much.)
